column4: I have a laptop that has got WIndows 7 64-bit as original operating system. Shall I use the 64 bit verion of Ubuntu or the 32 bit version?
you can use both
but if you have more than 3.5gb of ram you wont be able to utilize more than that on a i386 system
Ok, but will one be a better choice than the other?
then you should probably consider the 64bit version
I have 4GB of RAM.
Ok, will Ubuntu 32 bit nly handle at most 3.5GB?
you might want to consider running ubuntu virtualized
yes
Why running Ubuntu virtualizeD?
that way you dont have to dualboot, and you can run both OSs simultanously
Yeah, but then I will have less performance?
not necessarily
Why not dualboot? I want to use Ubuntu as default operating system but since the laptop has got WIndows 7 as default operating system I want to have it installed too.
That was ment fotr you.
what sort of work are you going to do on either OS?

I'm going to use browse the Net, mail, chat (Pidgin & Skype), Spotify. Well rather ordinary things, nothing special. Well, I'm going to code too. Like writing an executing Java programs I have written.
then you might as well run ubuntu virtualized :)
How will it affect the battery time? I have heard that Ubuntu has less battery time than Windows 7. How will a vitualisation solution affect the battery time?
it as only a suggestion :)
Well, but what benefits and disadvantages will I suffer running it virtualized instead of as dualboot?
benefits, no dualbooting, easier to install, drawbacks: more load
